definition: to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc

sentences.english: I don't know when we could get together again .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道何时能再聚首。

sentences.english: Whether the weather is good or bad, neither father nor Iam going to the gathering.
sentences.chinese: 无论气候是好是坏，父亲和我都不去到场那个聚首。

sentences.english: Mephisto - My brothers, at long last we stand re-united.
sentences.chinese: 我的兄弟，今天，我们终于重聚首。

sentences.english: A chance meeting brought the two old friends together again.
sentences.chinese: 偶然的相遇使两位老朋友再一次聚首。

sentences.english: It's just a bunch of bosses meeting up and filling in the forms.
sentences.chinese: 这只不过是一群老板聚首并填写表格。

sentences.english: For though they may be parted There is still a chance that they will see.
sentences.chinese: 即便是现在天各一方，也不见得有生之年不会再聚首。

sentences.english: The Olympic Games is a very good arena for world-class athletes to meet and compete with each other.
sentences.chinese: 奥运会是世界级运动员聚首竞技的最佳场合。

sentences.english: Meeting after 25 years, youth no more, genuine still.
sentences.chinese: 25年后再聚首，青春不再，真诚依旧。

sentences.english: Whether the acclimate is good or bad, neither ancestor nor I am traveling to the acquisition.
sentences.chinese: 无论气象是好是坏，父亲和我都不去加入那个聚首。

definition: to get together all at once
to meet together/to assemble (of a group of people)
to see each other/to meet in person
to meet/to run into (sb)/to get together (with sb)
to talk freely/to discuss without inhibition
to gather happily under one roof
